title: The Halloween Rally Isn’t a Stock Nightmare Before Christmas
text:
Gaining an edge on the stock market is hard. The market is supposed to be efficient—distilling all available information into stock prices instantaneously. But there are some stock-market curiosities that are difficult to explain by fundamentals alone—and which aggressive traders can try to exploit. Call them the market’s supernatural phenomena.

“Sell in May and go away” is one of those strange market trends. The adage describes the market’s tendency to underperform in the summer and outperform in the first and fourth quarters...
description: The Santa stock market rally is a thing, and it turns out that returns on the day of trick-or-treating is usually a treat for stocks.
